CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Mission description script
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: The CTS5 float mission is defined by a concatenation of elementary steps (see float manual for details).

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Event log level of detail
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Level of events stored in the associated log file ([0-3]).

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Decimal and column separators for data files (*.csv)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: The CTD can be transmitted in a CSV file. The first character of this parameter defines the decimal character to use, the second character defines the column separator to use.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: IP address of the float on a local connection via Bluetooth
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: IP address of the float for a bluetooth connection.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: System task list
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: List of tasks considered by the float (see float manual for details).

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Enable/disable "user" trace files
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Enable/disable user log file generation and transmission.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Enable/disable "system" trace files
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Enable/disable system log file generation and transmission.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Enable/disable complete self-test
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Perform a full auto-test (RUDICS server connection test) at float deployment (Yes=1/No=0).A full auto-test includes a connection test on the RUDICS server and a GPS fix acquisition.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Feedback-related risk criterion
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Set the feedback risk level used to decide if a feedback, raised by the sensor board, should be accepted by the vector board (number between 0: lowest risk and 4:highest risk) (see float manual for details).

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Maximum buoyancy recovery
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Enable/disable heavy float alarm. Heavy float alarm should be disabled if a 'heavy float deployment' is wanted.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: External pressure offset after effective surface only
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: The surface pressure offset is sampled only if an Iridium transmission or a GPS session occured (to be sure that the pressure offset is sampled at the surface). Original proposed names was: CONFIG_SecuredPressureOffsetSampledAtSurface_LOGICAL

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Time stamping format for data files (*.csv)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: The CTD can be transmitted in a CSV file. This parameter is used to set the format of the measurement times (0: seconds elapsed since 01/01/1900, 1: Excel format, 2: Unix format, 3: Mac format).

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Mandatory additional memory card for the mission
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: An additional memory card is requested for some missions (ex: under-ice mission). This parameter is designed to fail the autotest if the requested additional memory card is not present.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Rate of descent threshold for SV action (cm/s)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Float minimum descent speed before activating the valve.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Rate of ascent threshold for pump action (cm/s)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Float minimum ascent speed before activating the pump.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Typical rate of descent (cm/s)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Descent speed during downcast (can be used to estimate the time to descent from parking pressure to profile pressure)

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Typical rate of ascent (cm/s)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: ascent speed during upcast (can be used to estimate the profile duration).

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Pressure tolerance for positioning in descent (dbar)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Defines the target pressure interval for float stabilisation at parking or profile depth (in dbars).

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Pressure tolerance for positioning in ascent (dbar)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Defines the target pressure interval for float stabilisation during ascent at a prescribed depth. The prescibed depth could be the PRES threshold to start low ascent (but I think this should not be in the definition which should stay more generic).

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Pressure tolerance before repositioning in park (dbar)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Defines the target pressure interval for float drift at parking or profile depth (in dbars).

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Pressure tolerance for positioning in park (dbar)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Defines the target pressure interval before performing a buoyancy readjustment to reposition during the drift at parking depth. When a PRES measurement (sampled to monitor the float drift at parking depth) is outside the [parking_pressure +- CONFIG_PressureTargetToleranceBeforeReposition_dbar] interval, the float adjust its buoyancy.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Pressure monitoring period during descent (s)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Period of the pressure checks during the float descent (after CONFIG_BuoyancyReductionSecondThreshold_dbar).

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Pressure monitoring period during ascent (s)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Period of the pressure checks during the float ascent to surface.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Pressure monitoring period during drift (s)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Period of the pressure checks during the float drift at park or profile depth.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Maximum volume of an SV action during descent/repositioning (cm3)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: This information is used as a threshold for the valve action durations. The valve flow is known for each float and CONFIG_OilVolumeMaxPerValveAction_cm^3 is converted to a maxDurationOfValveAction.  During descent phases the float regularly computes a valve duration to sink to the target depth. In some specific cases the result can be a huge valve action duration and the result must be thresholded by maxDurationOfValveAction.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Maximum volume of a pump action during repositioning (cm3)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: This information is used as a threshold for the pump action duration for reposition in the parking drift interval. The pump flow is known for each float and CONFIG_OilVolumeMaxPerPumpActionReposition_cm^3 is converted to a maxDurationOfPumpActionReposition.  When a reposition should be performed, the float computes the needed pump action duration. In some specific cases the result can be a huge pump action duration and the result must be thresholded by maxDurationOfPumpActionReposition.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Emergence reduction threshold 1 (dbar)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: First threshold of the buoyancy reduction phase (see float manual for explanations).

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Emergence reduction threshold 2 (dbar)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Second threshold of the buoyancy reduction phase  (see float manual for explanations).

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Fixed volume of a pump action during ascent (cm3)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Nominal oil volume of each pump action during ascent.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Fixed volume of a pump action during braking (cm3)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Nominal oil volume of each pump action during descent (when the float brakes because of a too fast descent speed).

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: SV activation time during phase 2 of emergence reduction (cs)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Duration of the valve actions during the second phase of the buoyancy reduction (between CONFIG_BuoyancyReductionFirstThreshold_dbar and CONFIG_BuoyancyReductionSecondThreshold_dbar).

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: SV activation factor during phase 2 of emergence reduction
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Define the period of valve actions during the second phase of the buoyancy reduction (between CONFIG_BuoyancyReductionFirstThreshold_dbar and CONFIG_BuoyancyReductionSecondThreshold_dbar). The valve is open during CONFIG_ValveTimeActionBuoyancyReduction_csec each CONFIG_ValveTimeActionBuoyancyReduction_csec*CONFIG_ValveActionPeriodFactorBuoyancyReduction_NUMBER.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Fixed emergence volume (cm3)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Volume of the last pump action of the buoyancy acquisition phase. Original proposed name was: CONFIG_PumpActionOilVolumeBuoyancyAcquisition_cm^3

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: End of ascent detection threshold (dbar)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Threshold used by the float to stop ascent speed control and pump actions.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Deceleration during ascent (0 = none, 1 = low, 5 = high)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: This factor defines the speed of the ascent phase (between 0: nominal speed and 5: lowest speed).

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Braking power in ascent abortion (multiplies P15)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: This factor defines the oil volume transferred from the external bladder when a profile evasion occurs and the float has to brake. The transferred oil volume is CONFIG_ProfileEvasionAscentSpeedFactor_NUMBER times the oil volume of the last pump action.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Parking drift depth (dbar)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: park pressure - this may change if the float is reprogrammed and must be reported in the mission configuration settings

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Measurement drift depth (dbar)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: profile pressure - this may change if the float is reprogrammed and must be reported in the mission configuration settings

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Pattern duration (s)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: For APEX and ARVOR floats this is the total duration of one cycle, usually 240 hours (10 days). For SOLO floats this is the total duration of one cycle, assuming that all float operations reach their full time-out intervals before moving to the next float stage. Typically the actual cycle time will be shorter than this value.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Time of presence at the surface
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Time of day of float surfacing - could be hour of the float surfacing or could be stored as seconds when set as hh:mm:ss (e.g. for PROVOR CTS5)

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Enable/disable GPS position acquisition
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: The float performs a GPS session to acquire a GPS fix at the end of the cycle (Yes=1/No=0).

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Enable/disable transmission session
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: The float performs a telemetry transmission at the end of the cycle (Yes=1/No=0).

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Low battery voltage detection threshold (V)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Min threshold of battery level before raising a "low battery no load" alarm.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: High internal pressure detection threshold (mbar)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Max threshold of internal pressure level before raising a "high internal pressure" alarm.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Detection threshold for inconsistent external pressure jumps (cm/s)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Max threshold of vertical speed level before raising a "External pressure sensor failure" alarm.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Low external pressure detection threshold (dbar)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Min threshold of external pressure before raising a "Low external pressure" alarm.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Detection threshold for high external pressure / pressure limit (dbar)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Max threshold of external pressure before raising a "High external pressure" alarm.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Detection of broken external pressure sensor (successive errors)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Max number of successive errors from the external pressure sensor before raising a "External pressure sensor failure" alarm.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Detection threshold for grounding during descent (cm3)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: This information is a threshold used to detect a grounding of the float. If there is no vertical motion after having tranferred CONFIG_OilVolumeMinForGroundingDetection_cm^3 through the valve, the gounded flag is activated and the float acts as configurated by the CONFIG_GroundingMode_LOGICAL parameter.So, yes it is a configuration parameter (and I can easily understand that it can be modified via remote control since some PROVOR floats have experienced erroneous grounding detection (under study but perhaps due to in-situ conditions).

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Detection threshold for snagging during ascent (cm3)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: This information is a threshold used to detect a hanging of the float. If there is no ascent vertical motion after having tranferred CONFIG_OilVolumeMinForHangingDetection_cm^3 through the pump the hanged alarm is activated.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Detection of high rate of descent (braking)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Max threshold of descent speed before raising a "braking" alarm.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Low battery voltage detection threshold (min. on pump) (V)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Min threshold of battery level before raising a "low battery load" alarm.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Delay time at surface "SA" stage before loop (s)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Surface temporization (step 'SA' of the mission) before loops ([0-86400 (24 h)]) (see float manual for details).

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Delay time at surface "SA" stage in "pattern" loop (s)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Surface temporization (step 'SA' of the mission) during pattern loops ([0-7200 (2 h)]) (see float manual for details).

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Delay time at surface "SA" stage in "cycle" loop (s)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Surface temporization (step 'SA' of the mission) during cycle loops ([0-7200 (2 h)]) (see float manual for details).

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Delay time for test ("TC" stage) (s)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Test temporization (step 'TC' of the mission) ([0-600 (10 min)]) (see float manual for details).

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Enable/disable GPS position acquisition at end of life
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: The float performs a GPS session to acquire a GPS fix in each End Of Life transmission (Yes=1/No=0).

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Transmission period at end of life (s)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Period of the Iridium transmission when in End Of Life mode (in minutes).

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: List of alarms that can cause end of life (alarms 18 and 19 cannot be modified)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: List of alarms which can make the float transitioning to the End Of Life mode.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Management method for grounding detection during descent parking
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Action performed by the float when a grounding is detected. 0: the float changes its drift pressure, 1: the float stays on the seabed until the next phase of the cycle. For PROVOR CTS5 the number assigned to each mode has changed - see float manual for details for this model.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Set point offset in case of grounding management by correction (dbar)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: If in grounding mode 0, the float changes its drift pressure to its programmed one minus this value only if its current pressure is greater than this value.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Detection management method for snagging during ascent
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Action performed by the float when a hanging is detected (see float manual for details). [JP additional comments on behaviour for PROVOR floats: The hanging mode is the same idea as the grounding mode but for an ascent phase. When the float detects a too low vertical motion after having activated its pump to try to ascend it enters in a hanging mode (it is probably stuck at the sea floor). This parameter configures (with the same idea as CONFIG_GroundingMode_NUMBER for grounding) what should be the actions to perform to try to escape from hanging (it can activate its pump and valve alternatively to try to escape or abandon the ascent and switch to the next scheduled task].

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Minimum pressure for correction in case of grounding detection
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: If in grounding mode 0, the float changes its drift pressure only if its current pressure is greater than this value.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Management method for grounding detection during descent profile
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Action performed by the float when a grounding is detected during descent to profile depth. For PROVOR CTS5 floats: 2: the float stays on the seabed until the ascent start time, 3: the ascent starts immediately.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Depth for "slow" start of ascent (dbar)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Pressure threshold to start the slow ascent speed phase.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Depth for "slow" start of ascent (dbar)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Pressure threshold to start the slow ascent speed phase.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Depth for execution of ice detection test (dbar)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Pressure threshold to start the acoustic ice detection test.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Duration of ice detection test
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Duration of the ice detection test.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: DNIS number associated with the SIM card
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: DNIS number of the SIM card of the float.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Login of account associated with float (on the server)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Transmission identifier of the float.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Serial port number
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Serial port number used by the Iridium device.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Maximum duration of Iridium session (s)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Connection time-out, i.e. maximum transmission period for one telemetry session

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Block size for file segmentation
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Max size for transmitted files (in kbyte). Larger files are split before transmission.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Measurement file format (*.csv, *.hex extended, *.hex standard)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Format of the transmitted CTD data (0: CSV format, 1: extended hex format, 2: standard hex format) (see float manual for details).

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: File transmission mode (standard, extended, high speed)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: File transmission mode (0: standard, 1: extended, 2: streaming).

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Mechanics identification
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Reference of the hydraulic device.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Total oil volume in the hydraulic system (cm3)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Total volume of oil in the hydraulic device.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Serial port number
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Serial port number used by the sensor board.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Power output number
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Power output port number used by the sensor board.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Enable/disable "$ADJUST" message
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Ask/inform the sensor board during hydraulic adjustments.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Enable/disable complete self-test
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Perform a full autotest.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Serial port number
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Serial port number used by the GPS device.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Power output number
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Power output port number used by the GPS device.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Enable/disable PPS synchronisation (external module)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: When the float Real Time Clock is set, also set the clock of the measurement card.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Enable/disable enhanced positioning (altitude 0m)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Use the GPS improved location mode. This mode can be used when the float altitude is 0 meter, it provides better locations.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Enable/disable system clock synchronization
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Set the float Real Time Clock with GPS time.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Zone 1 - Sampling period / descent to drift depth (s)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Sampling period of the <short_sensor_name> during the descent to parking pressure in the depth zone #<N> (in seconds).

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Zone 1 - Sampling period / parking depth drift (s)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Sampling period of the <short_sensor_name> during the drift at parking pressure in the depth zone #<N>.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Zone 1 - Sampling period / descent to measurement depth (s)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Sampling period of the <short_sensor_name> during the descent to profile pressure in the depth zone #<N> (in seconds).

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Zone 1 - Sampling period / measurement depth drift (s)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Sampling period of the <short_sensor_name> during the drift at profile pressure in the depth zone #<N>.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Zone 1 - Sampling period / ascent (s)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Sampling period of the <short_sensor_name> during the ascending profile in the depth zone #<N> (in seconds).

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Zone 1 – Acquisition type
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Power acquisition mode of the <short_sensor_name> in the depth zone #<N> (0 : none, 2 : pulsed, 3 : continuous).

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Zone 1 – Processing type
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Data processing output of the <short_sensor_name> in the depth zone #<N>  (see float manual for details).

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Zone 1 – Synchronisation type
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Data of the <short_sensor_name> can be reported as they have been sampled or synchronized with one CTD parameter (PRES or TEMP or PSAL). The synchronization is done with the timely closest sample of the CTD (see float manual for details).

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Zone 1 – Section depth
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Slices thickness for <short_sensor_name> in the depth zone #<N> (in dbar).

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Pressure threshold between zones 1 and 2
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Threshold between depth zone #N and depth zone #N+1 for <short_sensor_name>  (in dbar).

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Sensor warm-up time (ms)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Time, needed after the <short_sensor_name> is powered ON, to provide its first sample (in milli-seconds).

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Sensor shut down time (ms)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Minimum waiting time needed by the <short_sensor_name> between a switch OFF and a switch ON (in milli-seconds).

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Filtering index of first valid sample
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Rank of the first valid sample provided by the <short_sensor_name> (0 is the rank of the first sample).

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Pression de « cut-off » (dbar)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: The pressure at which the CTD pump is switched off.  As the float ascends, the code looks at the pressure and if <= CONFIG_CTDPumpStopPressure, the CTD is turned off. CTDPumpStopPressure is a firmware threshold and as such, data may continue to be collected for a limited span after the threshold is recognized. Especially in floats that return high resolution discrete data, there might be data collected shallower than the cut off, due to the discrete nature of the pressure data and also due to the time necessary for the firmware to turn off the CTD once the pressure threshold is reached. For example for SOLOII floats the CTD is switched off at 1dbar, and typically the shallowest data is from 0.5 to 0.8 dbar. This shallow data should be carefully assessed for its validity.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Enable/disable fast sampling period (1 Hz)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Configure CTD to 1 Hz sampling instead of 0.5 Hz usual one.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Enable/disable sub-surface duration optimization
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: If there is no need to reach the surface (cycle with no transmission phase), the float can start a new descent phase as soon as the 2 dbar thresold is reached (instead of waiting 10 minutes after the crossing of the CONFIG_AscentEndThreshold_dbar threshold).

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Enable/disable sub-surface brake action
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: If there is no need to reach the surface (cycle with no transmission phase), the float can brake after the crossing of the CONFIG_AscentEndThreshold_dbar threshold and start a new descent phase.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Enable/disable the pressure activation
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Use the pressure activation feature.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Pressure threshold for mission activation (dbar)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: depth at which float is set to pressure activate

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Maximum duration of the pressure test (s)
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: The pressure activation phase starts after the first successfull auto-test and ends (with the start of the float mission) at the end of the CONFIG_AUX_PressureActivationTimeout_seconds period. During this phase the float checks the external pressure and can start its mission as soon as a CONFIG_PressureActivation_dbar pressure is measured.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: TBD
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Count to volt conversion for battery measurements: counts measurement for the first calibration point.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: TBD
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Count to volt conversion for battery measurements: counts measurement for the second calibration point.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: TBD
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Count to volt conversion for battery measurements: volts measurement for the first calibration point.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: TBD
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Count to volt conversion for battery measurements: volts measurement for the second calibration point.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: TBD
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Count to mbar conversion for internal pressure measurements: counts measurement for the first calibration point.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: TBD
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Count to mbar conversion for internal pressure measurements: counts measurement for the second calibration point.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: TBD
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Count to mbar conversion for internal pressure measurements: mbar measurement for the first calibration point.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: TBD
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Count to mbar conversion for internal pressure measurements: mbar measurement for the second calibration point.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: TBD
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Serial port number used by the CTD.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Spring inhibition ascent end pressure
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Ice evasion depth for the spring inhibition part of the ISA algorithm.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Spring inhibition delay since last ISA detection
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Maximum delay (in days) since the last ice evasion date to raise a new ice evasion.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: ISA algorithm storing data start pressure
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Maximum sampling pressure used by ice cover detection algorithm.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: ISA algorithm storing data stop pressure
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Minimum sampling pressure used by ice cover detection algorithm.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: ISA algorithm storing data sampling period
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Period of the ice detection algorithm. "It is the pressure interval used by the float to collect T and S samples between CONFIG_IceDetectionMixedLayerPMax_dbar and CONFIG_IceDetectionMixedLayerPMin_dbar for the TEMP comparison." Origjnal proposed name was : CONFIG_IceDetectionPeriod_dbar

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: ISA algorithm start pres
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Start pressure of the ice detection algorithm.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: ISA algorithm reference temperature
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Ice temperature in [degree Celsius/1e3] where profiles are aborted because of ice formation conditions

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: ISA algorithm salinity coefficient
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Coefficient used when Salinity is considered in the ice evasion criteria (i.e. median(TEMP) < CONFIG_IceDetection_degC+CONFIG_IceDetectionSalinityCoefficient_NUMBER*median(PSAL)).

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: ISA algorithm applicable month
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: When is ice detection active - months in reverse order

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: AID algorithm start pressure
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Maximum sampling pressure used by ice cover detection AID algorithm.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: AID algorithm stop pressure
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Minimum sampling pressure used by ice cover detection AID algorithm.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: AID algorithm sampling period
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Period of the ice cover detection AID algorithm.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: AID algorithm next measurement reach
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Used to compute the depth of the next ping (next ping depth = current depth - CONFIG_AidIceDetectionNextMeasReach_meter + CONFIG_AidIceDetectionNextMeasMargin_meter).

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: AID algorithm next measurement margin
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Used to compute the depth of the next ping (next ping depth = current depth - CONFIG_AidIceDetectionNextMeasReach_meter + CONFIG_AidIceDetectionNextMeasMargin_meter).

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: AID algorithm number of distance meas
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Number of distance measurements to use in the ice cover detection AID algorithm.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: AID algorithm linear correction
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Linear correction factor applied to the measured distances.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: AID algorithm dbar to meter coefficient
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Meter to decibar conversion coefficient.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: AID algorithm min threshold for valid meas
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Minimum distance threshold for a valid measurement.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: AID algorithm max diff between distance meas
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Maximum distance difference allowed between distance measurements of a given subsampling.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: AID algorithm min draught
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Minimum draught to abort profile.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: AID algorithm min number of detections
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Minimum number of detections to abort profile.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: AID algorithm max draught difference for detection
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Maximum draught difference allowed between measurements.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: AID algorithm max distance to target to abort ascent
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Maximum distance to the detected object to abort profile.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: AID algorithm applicable month
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: When is ice detection AID algorithm active - months in reverse order.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Pressure to abort ascent
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Ice evasion depth. This is a parameter for AC1 ice algorithm which abort the profile at a prescribed depth (CONFIG_IceEvasionDepth_dbar) without any check on environmental conditions (as described in my email, AC1, ISA and AID algorithm are used together in the ice version of the CTS5).

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Applicable month
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: When is ice evasion active - months in reverse order. This is a parameter for AC1 which provides the months it should be used.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Number of depth zones.
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Number of depth zones defined for the <short_sensor_name> sensor while sampling during the <cycle_phase_name> phase of the cycle.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Start pressure to define the depth zone.
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Start pressure to define the depth zone  #<N> of the <short_sensor_name> sensor while sampling during the <cycle_phase_name> phase of the cycle.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Stop pressure to define the depth zone.
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Stop pressure to define the depth zone #<N> of the <short_sensor_name> sensor while sampling during the <cycle_phase_name> phase of the cycle.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Sampling period for the depth zone.
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Sampling period for the depth zone #<N> of the <short_sensor_name> sensor while sampling during the <cycle_phase_name> phase of the cycle.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Number of additional raw data sampled for the sampling scheme.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Number of subsamplings for data sampled with the sampling scheme.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Data processing mode of the concerned subsampling.
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Data processing mode for the subsampling #<SubS> of the data sampled within the sampling scheme #<S> of the <short_sensor_name> sensor while sampling during the <cycle_phase_name> phase of the cycle.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Data processing rate of the concerned subsampling.
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Data processing rate for the subsampling #<SubS> of the data sampled within the sampling scheme #<S> of the <short_sensor_name> sensor while sampling during the <cycle_phase_name> phase of the cycle.

CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Payload sensor miscellaneous static configuration parameter
CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: The Apf frame definition allows for a variable number of spectrometer pixels (also called channels) to be included in the frame. The two pixel values are configured indirectly via the wavelength range of the spectrum to be output (Suna Hardware Manual, section 4.2.3, input/output configuration parameters, data wavelength low/high.) The firmware converts the wavelength values to spectrometer pixels.

The firmware converts the wavelength values to spectrometer pixels.
